isis.stitle: FE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - Description - Front End

svcprocinfo.para: The front end components include the following areas: the front bumper assembly, the grille and front access panel, windshield wipers, washers and wiper motor access doors. Also included in the front end components are the destination board, cross view mirror assemblies, the crossing gate, red and amber warning lights and windshield assembly.

calloutgroup.callout1: WINDSHIELD WIPER RESERVOIR / POWER STEERING RESERVOIR

svcsubproc.title: FE Front Bumper
svcsubproc.para: The front bumper assembly is a single piece wrap around bumper. The bumper assembly is bolted to the chassis frame. The bumper also includes the crossing gate and opening in the bumper for the chassis mounted tow hooks.

svcsubproc.title: Crossing Control Gate
svcsubproc.para: The Crossing Control gate ( Figure 8, Item 1) is a standard component on the FE Series bus. The gate is activated by the door opening mechanism and bus warning lights.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Crossing Control Gate and Front Bumper

calloutgroup.callout1: CROSSING GATE MOTOR AND MOUNTING ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Headlight And Directional Light Assemblies
svcsubproc.para: The headlight assemblies and directional lights are located on the cab front below the outer edge of the chassis windshield. The headlights are a single rectangular sealed beam headlight with high and low beam actuation at the driver position. The directional and running light assemblies are located outboard of the headlights, and are designed for a wide field of visibility. The headlight sealed beams and directional lamp bulbs are easily accessible for service and replacement as may be required.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Headlight and Directional Light Assemblies

svcsubproc.title: FE Grille
svcsubproc.para: The FE grille assembly is a lightweight composite assembly that tilts open to access the radiator fill port, the radiator heater supply cut off valve, coolant level site glass and the air operated door pressure switch.

calloutgroup.callout1: WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR ACCESS PANEL / AIR RESTRICTION INDICATOR

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Wiper And Windshield Wiper Motor Access Panels
svcsubproc.para: The FE bus windshield wiper motor access is through a frontal access panel on each side of the bus. Each windshield wiper assembly is located on the frontal access door on each side. Flip latches secure the door in the closed position. The windshield washer connection hoses are attached to the wiper assembly at the access doors. The passenger side frontal access door also allows access to the air filter restriction indicator.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Windshield Wipers and Windshield Wiper Motor Access Panels

svcsubproc.title: Windshield
svcsubproc.para: The FE bus windshield is a four-piece flat glass windshield assembly. The windshield is mounted and secured in place utilizing an "H" style window seal. Each panel of the windshield assembly is completely removable without removing the other windshield sections.

svcsubproc.title: Cross View Mirrors
svcsubproc.para: The Cross View Mirrors are also a standard feature on the FE Series school bus. These mirrors allow cross frontal views of the students' activity at the front and sides of the bus entrance.

calloutgroup.callout1: PASSENGER SIDE CROSS VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Exterior Rear View Mirrors
svcsubproc.para: The exterior rear view mirrors are located on each side of the bus. The mirror assembly consists of a flat panel upper mirror with convex lower panel. The driver side rear view mirror is located directly forward of the driver window assembly. The passenger side rear view mirror is mounted above and forward of the passenger entry door. Heated rear view mirrors are an available option.

calloutgroup.callout1: PASSENGER SIDE EXTERIOR MOUNTED REAR VIEW MIRROR

svcsubproc.title: Destination Board
svcsubproc.para: The destination board is located above the front windshield assembly in the front end cap assembly. The destination board may consist of an optional backlighted panel. The standard destination board is marked with identifying letter designation "SCHOOL BUS".

svcsubproc.title: Front Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: The FE school bus front warning lights are located above the windshield outboard of the bus destination board. The light configuration may vary with the state or school district regulations. The red flashing front warning lights are required on all school buses. An optional amber flashing light may be located inboard of the red warning light and outboard of the bus destination board.
